attributes.short_header: Pedestrian access to N Station will be through Legends Way beginning Saturday, Oct 22, through Feb 2017, due to the Hub on Causeway Project
attributes.header: Pedestrian access to North Station will be through Legends Way beginning Saturday, October 22, through February 2017, due to the Hub on Causeway Project
attributes.description: The new path of travel will be along a protected path along Legends Way and across Causeway Street to the station entrances along Haverhill Street. The path will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

attributes.short_header: Buses replacing Orange Line service between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations on January 28 - 29 from start to end of service.
attributes.header: Buses replacing Orange Line service between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations on January 28 - 29 from start to end of service.
attributes.description:
Due to the MassDOT Woods Memorial Project, buses will replace Orange Line trains between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations in both directions from start to end of service on Saturday, January 28, 2017 and Sunday, January 29, 2017.

Regular Orange Line train service will resume at the start of service on Monday, January 30, 2017. All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Shuttling the following stops: 
Oak Grove 
Malden Center
Wellington

attributes.short_header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth St underpass will remain closed until February 28, 2017
attributes.header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth Street underpass will remain closed until February 28, 2017.
attributes.description:
Due to Copley Place construction being performed by the Simon Company, the Dartmouth Street underpass  leading to and from the west side of Dartmouth Street at Back Bay Station will be temporarily closed until February 28, 2017.

Customers are encouraged to use the stations main entrance on the east side of Dartmouth Street during the underpass closure. 

Affected routes:
Orange Line
Framingham/Worcester Line
Needham Line
Franklin Line
Providence/Stoughton Line

attributes.short_header: Elev. 941 N Station - Lobby to the Commuter Rail & Boston Garden will remain closed until further notice due to construction of the Boston G
attributes.header: Elevator 941 NORTH STATION - Lobby to the Commuter Rail and Boston Garden will remain closed until further notice due to construction of the Boston Garden Development.
attributes.description: If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). If boarding, cross Causeway Street to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to street) or travel one-tenth of a mile down Haverhill Street to the entrance located at the intersection of Haverhill Street and Valenti Way.

attributes.description: The Elliot Street bridge construction has been completed. Regular inbound and outbound Route 59 bus service will now operate through Central Ave

attributes.short_header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill & Bradford except Trains 216 & 222
attributes.header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill and Bradford except Trains 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill).
attributes.description:
Due to the Merrimack River Bridge project, trains that operate between Bradford and Haverhill will only use the inbound track. Trains that are bused between Haverhill and Bradford will board on the outbound platform at Bradford for service into Boston. 

Note: Train 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and Train 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill) are bused from Haverhill Station to Bradford Station.

The outbound platform at Bradford may be accessed via the crossing that is south (to the right when facing the tracks from the parking lot) of the mini-high platforms. Alternatively, the outbound platform can also be accessed via the sidewalk from Laurel Avenue. 

Affected stops:
Bradford
Haverhill

attributes.description:
Due to the MassDOT Woods Memorial Project, buses will replace Orange Line trains between Wellington and Oak Grove Stations in both directions beginning at approximately 8:45 p.m. through the end of service on the following dates:

- Tuesday, January 24, 2017.
- Wednesday, January 25, 2017.

Regular Orange Line train service will resume at the start of service the next day. All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities.

Malden Center
Wellington

attributes.header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.description: If entering the station, cross Tremont Street to the Boston Common and use Park Street Elevator 978 to the Green Line westbound platform. Red Line platform access is available via the elevator beyond the fare gates. If exiting the station, please travel down the Winter Street Concourse toward Downtown Crossing Station, exit through the fare gates, and take Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 to the street level.

attributes.short_header: Blue Line will be suspended between Bowdoin and State St during the weekends of Jan 21-22 and 28-29 due to necessary station maintenance
attributes.service_effect: Suspension of service on Blue Line
attributes.header: Blue Line service will be suspended between Bowdoin and State Street Stations during the weekends of January 21-22 and 28-29 due to necessary station maintenance.
attributes.description:
Due to crews performing necessary station maintenance, Blue Line service will be suspended in both directions between Bowdoin and State Street Stations from start to end of service on the following weekends:
 
-Saturday, January 21, 2017  Sunday, January 22, 2017
-Saturday, January 28, 2017  Sunday, January 29, 2017
 
During this time, Blue Line service will terminate/originate at State Street Station. For westbound service towards Government Center & Bowdoin, please exit the Blue Line at State Street and travel at the street-level. For eastbound service, please travel at the street-level to State Street in order to board the Blue Line. Regular Blue Line service will resume at the start of service the following Monday. 
 
Please note, regular Green Line service will operate throughout these weekend service suspensions. Green Line passengers looking to connect to the Blue Line at Government Center will need to exit at Government Center and travel to nearby State Street. Passengers are also encouraged to utilize Orange Line service at Haymarket to travel to and connect with Blue Line service at State Street. 
 
Passengers seeking accessible service between Bowdoin and State Street Stations should please see station personnel for shuttle bus service between Bowdoin, Government Center, and State Street.
 
Affected Stations:
Bowdoin
Government Center
State Street
